intro: Hermannia denudata var. denudata, commonly known as the naked hermannia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant has simple, opposite, and usually hairy leaves that are lanceolate in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
